intro: Perityle cinerea, commonly known as the gray perityle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense, compact heads. Perityle cinerea is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
